reviews.review_msg: Good professor, gave info well & clearly knows what he is talking about. Sometimes his class lacked structure and needs to emphasize the main class concepts more. It was not a hard class & the information is pretty basic. Its like a history class. Just come to lecture and write everything down. I didn't read the textbook his lecture is enough.

Mean spirited in his humor. He goes out of his way to make students look stupid. Not helpful where it comes to formulating a paper or understanding readings. If you ask him for help privately he'll make fun of you for asking. The course also is 100% methodology so if you like politics avoid it, it's strictly social science methods.

Absolutely brutal class, do not take if you do not need it! Professor is not helpful at all, labs and lectures do not coincide, the textbook taught me more than lectures did. Not clear in lectures/ explaining concepts. So. BAD!
YOu don't know what grades you are getting until the end, which is pretty unfair. He is just unfair.

Teaches the mandatory class well.  Most aren't interested in stats or research methods, but like another reviewer here has said, he really does make the best of it.  He kept my interest during the semester and it's too bad he doesn't teach outside of this stream of Poli Sci or I'd be willing to take him for another course for sure.
nice guy, good lectures, making stats interesting is not easy. warwick does a good job at keeping things alive
this prof makes the best of a boring course, people only take it as it is a major req.  Prof is helpful and explains material well and offers extra help if needed.

If you put effort into the class you will do good. Warwick is extremly helpful and will help explain concepts. However, Warwick goes off on too many examples which confuses what he is trying to teach. Moreover, sometimes it is hard to understand what he is saying, reading the text is essential.

Really helpful. He realizes that his course is more math oriented-- and you generally shouldn't mention the 'm' word to arts students, but he does an awesome job explaining everything. Is also very willing to give you extra help. He definitely has a high level of interest in his course, and he wants to share his enthusiasm with the students.

His lectures were well done though I'm still a bit tender he stuck me with the guy who had a major learning disability (on the grounds that if I went with someone else it would look like he discriminated against an aboriginal). Overall though good guy, interesting material.
Best Professor I have had! Very interesting, brililant and engaging.
